body_html:
I don't think this error is specific to CMake, but rather the unsupported build platform. Unfortunately I don't have a ppc64le machine to reproduce the error, and it's not one of our supported platforms, so I'll have to mark this as "community support".

In case it's helpful, here are a couple of random suggestions:

  • Have you tried building with Bazel? (I'm not sure if Bazel is supported on this platform either.) Or the (simpler) Makefile build?
  • Can you try adding the -mcmodel=large compilation option? (as suggested here)

/cc @namrata-ibm, who has been building for PPC, in case this error looks familiar.

In case it's helpful, here are a couple of random suggestions:

Can you try adding the -mcmodel=large compilation option? (as suggested here)

body:
I don't think this error is specific to CMake, but rather the unsupported build platform. Unfortunately I don't have a `ppc64le` machine to reproduce the error, and it's not one of our supported platforms, so I'll have to mark this as "community support".

In case it's helpful, here are a couple of random suggestions:

* Have you tried building with Bazel? (I'm not sure if Bazel is supported on this platform either.) Or the (simpler) Makefile build?
* Can you try adding the `-mcmodel=large` compilation option? (as suggested [here](https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/community/wikis/home?lang=en#!/wiki/W51a7ffcf4dfd_4b40_9d82_446ebc23c550/page/IBM%20Advance%20Toolchain%20for%20PowerLinux%20Documentation))

/cc @namrata-ibm, who has been building for PPC, in case this error looks familiar.
